samples.ui
Class TextField

java.lang.Object
  samples.ui.Component
      samples.ui.TextField

public class TextField
extends Component

This class implements an editable text field which can hold and display a single line of text. Its cursor can be scrolled left/right through the text, and various input modes which control the set of characters that appear when keys are pressed. An optional "password" display mode masks out the text with asterisks.

Input modes: Alphanumeric, Numeric, Email Address, Username, ASCII

Display modes: Normal, Password

MASK_PASSWORD_CHAR_DUR

public static final int MASK_PASSWORD_CHAR_DUR
Milliseconds after which the last character entered in password display mode will be replaced with an asterisk.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_ALPHANUMERIC

public static final int ENTRY_ALPHANUMERIC
Alphanumeric entry mode. These are the characters produced by cycling through presses on various handset keys:
  • 0 key: space ' ', and 0
  • 1 key: . , ? ! 1 @ ' - _ ( ) : / * % # + < > =
  • 2 key: a b c 2
  • 3 key: d e f 3
  • 4 key: g h i 4
  • 5 key: j k l 5
  • 6 key: m n o 6
  • 7 key: p q r s 7
  • 8 key: t u v 8
  • 9 key: w x y z 9

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_NUMERIC

public static final int ENTRY_NUMERIC
Numeric mode. Numbers only (keys 0-9 produce numbers 0-9)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_EMAILADDR

public static final int ENTRY_EMAILADDR
Email Address mode. Same as "Alphanumeric" mode, with the following exceptions:
  • 0 key: only 0
  • 1 key: . 1 @ - _ +

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_USERNAME

public static final int ENTRY_USERNAME
Username mode. Same as "Alphanumeric", with the following exceptions:
  • 0 key: only 0
  • 1 key: 1 _

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ENTRY_ASCII

public static final int ENTRY_ASCII
Full ASCII (ASCII chars 32-126, inclusive). Same as "Alphanumeric" mode, with the following exceptions:
  • 1 key: . , ? ! 1 @ ' - _ ( ) : / * % # + < > = " $ & ; \ [ ] ^ ` | { } ~

See Also:
Constant Field Values

keyReleased

public boolean keyReleased(int action,
                           int key)
Turns off "press-for-number" behavior if user was holding down a key.

Overrides:
keyReleased in class Component
Parameters:
action - The Canvas action code of the key released
key - The keycode of the key released
Returns:
true if the instance handled the event, and false if the instance ignored the event.

setFocus

public void setFocus(boolean foc)
Whenever the TextField gains focus, it starts an animation thread which waits for timeouts to perform the following actions:
  1. Blinks the cursor
  2. Performs press-for-number behavior if user holds down a key
  3. Masks out a recently entered character, if in password display mode
When the TextField loses focus, this thread exits.

Overrides:
setFocus in class Component
Parameters:
foc - Whether the instance has input focus.

keyPressed

public boolean keyPressed(int action,
                          int key)
Update the state of this instance in light of a key press action.

Overrides:
keyPressed in class Component
Parameters:
action - The type of action. The TextField class ignores the action parameter, but responds to a wide variety of key types corresponding to text entry events.
key - The key released.
Returns:
true if the instance handled the event, and false if the instance ignored the event.
